Based on the foregoing, the plaintiffs’ motion for class certification is GRANTED. It is so ORDERED.
SIGNED on this 3rd day of July, 2019.

extracted.value: Granted class certification for Class A (all individuals detained over 48 hours) and Class B (all individuals detained over 24 hours but under 48 hours) on July 3, 2019 (Dkt. No. 86)

evidence.source_document: Order and Findings on Sanctions and Motions
evidence.text: Therefore, the Court HOLDS that the following inference is appropriate based on the City’s conduct: It is established that (a) throughout the class period, the City of Houston had a policy of not releasing warrantless arrestees who had not received neutral determinations of probable cause within the constitutionally required period of time; (b) throughout the class period, the City’s policymakers were aware of this policy; and (c) the City’s policymakers acted with deliberate indifference to the unconstitutional policy and the constitutional violations that resulted.

extracted.value: The court granted plaintiffs' motion for sanctions and entered an adverse inference finding, holding that (a) the City of Houston had a policy of not releasing warrantless arrestees without timely probable cause determinations; (b) city policymakers were aware of this policy; and (c) they acted with deliberate indifference to the unconstitutional policy.

extracted.value: The court granted the plaintiffs' motion to certify the class in the Memorandum Opinion and Order dated July 3, 2019, which certified the class for claims related to unlawful detentions and the City's failure to provide prompt probable cause hearings within 48 hours of arrest.
